intro: Bouvardia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces showy, pink or white blossoms that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Bouvardia gracilipes is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
